properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST until January 12 at 8:41AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...
Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White River...
Wildcat Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 1 and a half inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Eagle Creek at Zionsville.
* from Saturday afternoon to Sunday morning.
* At  7:45 AM Friday the stage was 4.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 9.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday afternoon and
continue to rise to near 10.1 feet by late Saturday night.  It will
fall below flood stage by late Saturday night.
* At 11.0 feet...Noticeable flooding along Eagle Creek in the
Zionsville area affecting Lions Park, Creekside Nature Park and
Zionsville Golf Course.  Flooding likely of Temple Avenue between
Willow and Turkey Foot Roads, Ford Road near the Eagle Creek Bridge
near 96th St. on the Marion and Boone County Line and Noel Road in
northwest Marion County.  Turkey Foot Road north of Temple Avenue
and Holliday Road are flooded by more than 1 foot of water.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
